thread.title: ‘SNL’ Writer Deletes Tweet That Barron Trump May Be ‘Homeschool Shooter’
thread.title_full: ‘SNL’ Writer Deletes Tweet That Barron Trump May Be ‘Homeschool Shooter’

author: Beatrice Verhoeven, provided by
title: ‘SNL’ Writer Deletes Tweet That Barron Trump May Be ‘Homeschool Shooter’
text:
‘SNL’ Writer Deletes Tweet That Barron Trump May Be ‘Homeschool Shooter’ 1 / 1 Back to Gallery 
“Saturday Night Live” writer Katie Rich allegedly posted and later deleted a tweet in which she said Donald Trump’s 10-year-old son, Barron Trump, would become the “country’s first homeschool shooter.” 
Rich’s entire Twitter account has since been taken down. 
According to Mediate , on Friday, Rich wrote, “Barron will be this country’s first homeschool shooter.” As noted by the post’s time stamp, the tweet was up for about three hours and then deleted… but her followers were quick to notice. 
“SNL writer no doubt thinks bullying a 10-year-old CHILD is hilarious,” wrote one user. “This is truly sick. LEAVE BARRON ALONE!” Also Read: Rosie O'Donnell Finally Apologizes to Melania Trump for Barron Trump Autism Speculation 
Even Curt Schilling stepped in, writing “So glad liberals have Rosie, Michael Moore, Cher, Madonna and this a–clown. Thought Presidents kids were off limits?” 
However, one Twitter user defended Rich, writing, “Totally standing by the lady who said Barron will be the first homeschool shooter… when it’s right, it’s right.” Also Read: Rosie O'Donnell Dodges Melania Trump Questions in Bizarre Interview 
Mediaite added that Barron Trump is not homeschooled and is currently enrolled at Columbia Grammar and Preparatory School in New York. Melania Trump and Barron will remain in Manhattan and not move into the White House until he finishes school, Trump told reporters in November. 
A representative for Rich has not yet responded to TheWrap’s request for comment. 
See reactions to Rich’s tweet below. SNL writer no doubt thinks bullying a 10-year-old CHILD is hilarious. This is truly sick. LEAVE BARRON ALONE! pic.twitter.com/Px7XnvMaZe 
— Paula Bolyard (@pbolyard) January 20, 2017 The fact that writers and other people are willing to attack Barron Trump, a ten year-old, just shows how much we really needed change. 
— Jack Murphy (@RealJack) January 20, 2017 Cannot believe NBC/SNL writer Katie Rich apparently suggested 10 year old Barron Trump might be a "homeschool shooter" I hope they fire her.
